channel.title: [DELTA-317/Blurr Client] NPC Model Int/ID List Help?

item.title: [DELTA-317/Blurr Client] NPC Model Int/ID List Help?
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

I have been looking on the internet for a composed list of the NPC Models, yet to no avail. I was wondering if someone could link me to it or have one to post.

To explain what I am saying, I will compare it to the Item Int List. Basically, it tells you the IDs and Int’s of the original items on runescape. Example: “i == 1004 / model = 2775 / name string = null” etc. I wish to have this for NPCs as well. The original “built in” NPCs from runescape, such as the Grim Reaper/Death, I want his model id at the current moment. So that would be something like:

if(i == 2862) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.aString65 = "Death"; class5.anInt61 = 9001; class5.aByteArray89 = "The Grim Reaper himself!".getBytes(); //class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; //class5.anIntArray94[0] = 4095; }

With 4095 being his model number, his main model. However, this is not his model, this is just an example, that is the model id for the Spirit/CorpBeast. I wish for an original, non-custom file with each int explained, just as the item int list.txt is explained. Does this already exist? I feel like I have seen it before, however I cannot find it and I have been searching as thoroughly as I can.

Help?

Danielplanto

[size=14pt]PS. If this is against the rules please tell me, I am kind of unsure what to do about it at this point so I wish to ask, this is the only way I knew how to ask.[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: [DELTA-317/Blurr Client] NPC Model Int/ID List Help?
